t: Luke 6
Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath
Now*p it happened that He was passing through some*i grainfields on a Sabbath; and His disciples were picking the heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands, and eating the*i grain.*i
But some of the Pharisees said, “Why do you do what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
And Jesus answering them said, “Have*r you*r not*r even*r read*r what*r David*r did*r when*r he*r was*r hungry,*r he*r and*r those*r who*r were*r with*r him,*r

how*r he*r entered*r the*r house*r of*r God,*r and*r took*r and*r ate*r the*r consecrated*r bread*r which*r is*r not*r lawful*r for*r any*r to*r eat*r except*r the*r priests*r alone,*r and*r gave*r it*r to*r his*r companions?”*r
And He was saying to them, “The*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r Lord*r of*r the*r Sabbath.”*r
On*p another Sabbath He entered the synagogue and was teaching; and there was a man there whose right hand was withered.
The scribes and the Pharisees were watching Him closely to*i see*i if He healed on the Sabbath, so that they might find reason*i to accuse Him.
But He knew what they were thinking, and He said to the man with the withered hand, “Get*r up*r and*r come*r forward!”*r And he got up and came forward.
And Jesus said to them, “I*r ask*r you,*r is*r it*r lawful*r to*r do*r good*r or*r to*r do*r harm*r on*r the*r Sabbath,*r to*r save*r a*r life*r or*r to*r destroy*r it?”*r
After looking around at them all, He said to him, “Stretch*r out*r your*r hand!”*r And he did so;*i and his hand was restored.
But they themselves were filled with rage, and discussed together what they might do to Jesus.
Choosing the Twelve
It*p was at this time that He went off to the mountain to pray, and He spent the whole night in prayer to God.
And when day came, He called His disciples to Him and chose twelve of them, whom He also named as apostles:
Simon, whom He also named Peter, and Andrew his brother; and James and John; and Philip and Bartholomew;
and Matthew and Thomas; James the*i son*i of Alphaeus, and Simon who was called the Zealot;
Judas the*i son*i of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.

Jesus*p came down with them and stood on a level place; and there*i was*i a large crowd of His disciples, and a great throng of people from all Judea and Jerusalem and the coastal region of Tyre and Sidon,
who had come to hear Him and to be healed of their diseases; and those who were troubled with unclean spirits were being cured.
And all the people were trying to touch Him, for power was coming from Him and healing them*i all.

Builders and Foundations
